content.text: Bash unzip Command - Extract from ZIP archive
The unzip command is used to extract compressed files from a ZIP archive.
content.html: The unzip command is used to extract compressed files from a ZIP archive.

content.text: To extract files from a ZIP archive, use unzip archive.zip :
content.html: To extract files from a ZIP archive, use unzip archive.zip:

content.code:
unzip
archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
inflating: file1
inflating: file2
content.code_html:
unzip archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
inflating: file1
inflating: file2

content.text: Here are some common options you can use with the unzip command:
content.html: Here are some common options you can use with the unzip command:

content.text: The -l option lists all the files in the ZIP archive without extracting them.
content.html: The -l option lists all the files in the ZIP archive without extracting them.

content.code:
unzip
-l archive.zip
Length   Date   Time   Name
------   ----   ----   ----
1234  2025-04-10 12:00 file1
5678  2025-04-10 12:00 file2
------
2 files
content.code_html:
unzip -l archive.zip
Length   Date   Time   Name
------   ----   ----   ----
1234  2025-04-10 12:00 file1
5678  2025-04-10 12:00 file2
------
2 files

content.text: The -t option tests the integrity of the files in the ZIP archive.
content.html: The -t option tests the integrity of the files in the ZIP archive.

content.code:
unzip
-t archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
testing: file1 OK
testing: file2 OK
No errors detected in compressed data of archive.zip
content.code_html:
unzip -t archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
testing: file1 OK
testing: file2 OK
No errors detected in compressed data of archive.zip

content.text: The -d option extracts files to a specified directory.
content.html: The -d option extracts files to a specified directory.

content.code:
unzip
-d /path/to/extract/ archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
inflating: /path/to/extract/file1
inflating: /path/to/extract/file2
content.code_html:
unzip -d /path/to/extract/ archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
  inflating: /path/to/extract/file1
  inflating: /path/to/extract/file2

content.text: The -o option overwrites existing files without prompting.
content.html: The -o option overwrites existing files without prompting.

content.code:
unzip
-o archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
replacing: file1
replacing: file2
content.code_html:
unzip -o archive.zip
Archive: archive.zip
replacing: file1
replacing: file2

content.text: The -x option excludes specific files from being extracted.
content.html: The -x option excludes specific files from being extracted.

content.code:
unzip
archive.zip -x file1
Archive: archive.zip
inflating: file2
content.code_html:
unzip archive.zip -x file1
Archive: archive.zip
  inflating: file2

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which command allows you to extract compressed files from a ZIP archive?
content.html: Which command allows you to extract compressed files from a ZIP archive?
